page.title: 10Employment in Upper Bentley
page.content: {Employment}50 years ago in Bentley Pauncefoot was farming. Everyone in the family was involved in the milking from 3 years old. Breakfast followed at 9am after three hours work. Other{meals}were lunch which consisted of sandwiches at 1pm and supper was when work was finished at 11pm or when it was dark. There were no holidays. All children worked before and after school. Regular employment began at 14 years. Their job title was General Farmworker. Today it is Agricultural Worker.{Wages}then were 7s.6d per week, their father's earning 9d at 13 years. Other forms of payment were free rent and milk and occasionally a large joint of meat. Farm{machinery was introdued during the Second World War, one tractor per farm to help replace work force. Everything was worked by hand until then.
